test_message: Mode: valentine. I'm in a 2-year relationship with someone named Alex. We met at a coffee shop and I want to write them a love poem about that first meeting. The tone should be sweet and passionate. Please generate the content directly.

actual_response.title: Love Brewed at First Sight
actual_response.content:
Two years ago, the world paused in a coffee shop,
Steam curled in the air as my heartbeat rose and stopped.
You—Alex, a page-turner in hand, sunlight on your face—
A moment ordinary, transformed into fate’s embrace.

A nervous hello, the hush of porcelain and laughter,
Fingers brushing accidental, time tumbling ever after.
Hazelnut and hope blended in your smile so rare,
I tasted forever in the sweetness lingering there.

We poured our stories like cream into cups,
Each confession stirring something deep, waking us up.
You saw through my shyness, warmed my trembling heart—
Every glance, a spark, and every word, a work of art.

Now, love’s roasted rich, growing bold in every way,
Passion simmering between us like coffee at break of day.
Life’s little sips—of kisses, dreams, and laughter shared
All began with that first meeting—and the way you cared.
actual_response.shareable_quote: I tasted forever in the sweetness lingering there.
actual_response.image_prompt: A sunlit coffee shop scene, cozy and inviting, with two people gazing at each other over steaming mugs. Sunlight streams through large windows, casting warm golden light across rustic tables and shelves of books. The air glows with romance and the quiet magic of a first meeting.
